history.text: How to train your dragon was a great movie. What did you think about it?
Yes, it is a good entertaining movie.

I thought they did a good job producing the movie based on the British Book "How to train your dragon. Do you think read any of the book and 
how did you think they did portraying it within the movie?

Unfortunately, I didn't read the book. However, it is great deal watching the trained dragons fighting the evil ones. That too with the 3D animation effects with the expression of friendship between the characters.
I agree, the movie devotes a great deal of time to the battles of the dragons. There is the evil dragons and the tamed dragons, which dragon was your favorite?
Obviously the good dragon! The script is witty, intelligent.
What do you think about its commercial success?
I am not sure about that, but I do think that the ratings the critics gave the movie were pretty spot on. Do you agree with the ratings?
The ratings are pretty decent, it was not a failure movie though! What is your opinion about the 3-D animation?
I thought they did a really good job with the 3-d animation. It was a great mix between the conventional ways and bringing the screen to life.
I loved the part when Hiccup finds that he did not shoot down night fury and feels bad and sets him free. what was your favorite part
I loved all the scenes, I have enjoyed watching it every frame! What do you think on killing the dragons as depicted in the storyline?

I think that it just shows that peoples judgments get in the way of the realness of a situation. But it goes to show that  people can change their perception it they are just shown the way. That is one reason i love this movie
Do you like such Juvenile movies more?
They are ok, my kids watch them all the time. So I have seen it a few times because of this.
What about you do you usually watch them
I like cartoons and such Juvenile movies more than the other Genre.
Do you generally watch movies with good ratings, apart from sitting along with kids for such Juvenile?
I have a tendancy to look at the ratings and reviews before I watch them. But I don't just pick them based on the ratings. How about you?
I too follow the same as you mentioned. It is a good idea to watch for the ratings and reviews rather than feeling bad watching it.
I agree, Metacritic usually has acurate ratings. Did this movie make you want to watch it again
Yes true, I have watched it around 5 times. Do you agree with its ratings?
Yes I do, a 74/100 was very fair.
what did ou think of the ending of the movie
The ending was ecstatic, however, losing his leg part was not convincing!

I felt Stoick, the dad, was so arrogant, h
owever, later the storyline explained the reason for his stubbornness.
What did you feel when the dad and son fighting for the dragons! Which side were you?
I was on the dragons side
the end was great i absolutley loved it
I want to go watch it again now.
Do you agree with naming the Night Fury as Toothless?
